parts.text: {"word":"sacar","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"取り出す、出す、引き出す","english_definition":"to take out, to remove, to extract","examples":[{"sentence":"Sacó el libro de la mochila.","translation":"He took the book out of the backpack.","example_note":"取り出した。"},{"sentence":"¿Puedes sacar la basura?","translation":"Can you take out the trash?","example_note":"ゴミを出す。"},{"sentence":"Sacaron agua del pozo.","translation":"They drew water from the well.","example_note":"水を汲み出した。"}],"collocations":["sacar dinero (to withdraw money)","sacar una foto (to take a photo)","sacar la basura (to take out the trash)","sacar una conclusión (to draw a conclusion)","sacar una sonrisa (to elicit a smile)"],"synonyms":["extraer","retirar","obtener"],"antonyms":["meter","introducir","poner"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"得る、手に入れる、もらう","english_definition":"to obtain, to get, to receive","examples":[{"sentence":"Sacó buenas notas en el examen.","translation":"He got good grades on the exam.","example_note":"良い成績を得た。"},{"sentence":"Sacó un premio en la lotería.","translation":"He won a prize in the lottery.","example_note":"賞をもらった。"},{"sentence":"¿Qué sacas con mentir?","translation":"What do you gain by lying?","example_note":"嘘をついて何を得るのか？"}],"collocations":["sacar provecho (to take advantage of)","sacar una ventaja (to gain an advantage)","sacar conclusiones (to draw conclusions)","sacar el máximo partido (to get the most out of)"],"synonyms":["obtener","conseguir","recibir"],"antonyms":["perder","desaprovechar"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"（人を）連れ出す、（物を）持ち出す","english_definition":"to take someone or something out","examples":[{"sentence":"Sacó a su novia a cenar.","translation":"He took his girlfriend out to dinner.","example_note":"デートに連れ出した。"},{"sentence":"Sacó el perro a pasear.","translation":"He took the dog out for a walk.","example_note":"散歩に連れ出した。"},{"sentence":"Sacó las sillas al jardín.","translation":"He took the chairs out to the garden.","example_note":"庭に持ち出した。"}],"collocations":["sacar a bailar (to ask someone to dance)","sacar a pasear (to take for a walk)","sacar de paseo (to take for a ride)"],"synonyms":["llevar","conducir","acompañar"],"antonyms":["dejar","abandonar"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"明らかにする、暴露する","english_definition":"to reveal, to expose","examples":[{"sentence":"Sacaron a la luz la corrupción.","translation":"They exposed the corruption.","example_note":"不正を明らかにした。"},{"sentence":"Sacó a relucir sus errores.","translation":"He brought up his mistakes.","example_note":"彼の過ちを暴露した。"}],"collocations":["sacar a la luz (to bring to light)","sacar a relucir (to bring up)"],"synonyms":["revelar","descubrir","exponer"],"antonyms":["ocultar","encubrir"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"（才能などを）発揮させる、引き出す","english_definition":"to bring out, to develop (a talent, etc.)","examples":[{"sentence":"El profesor sacó lo mejor de sus alumnos.","translation":"The teacher brought out the best in his students.","example_note":"生徒たちの最高のものを引き出した。"},{"sentence":"Este curso te ayudará a sacar tu potencial.","translation":"This course will help you develop your potential.","example_note":"潜在能力を発揮させる。"}],"collocations":["sacar el máximo partido (to get the most out of)","sacar provecho (to take advantage of)"],"synonyms":["desarrollar","explotar","aprovechar"],"antonyms":["desaprovechar","ignorar"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","intransitive","definition":"似ている","english_definition":"to resemble","examples":[{"sentence":"Se parece mucho a su padre, saca a su padre.","translation":"He looks a lot like his father, he takes after his father.","example_note":"父親に似ている。"}],"collocations":["sacar a (to resemble)"],"synonyms":["parecerse a"],"antonyms":["diferenciarse de"]}],"etymology":{"value":"From Latin *ex- + *trahere, meaning to pull out.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/saˈkaɾ/","syllables":"sa-car"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["saco","sacas","saca","sacamos","sacáis","sacan"],"past_simple":"saqué","future_simple":"sacaré","conditional_simple":"sacaría","present_subjunctive":"saque","past_subjunctive":"sacara","imperative":"saca"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Sacar' is a versatile verb with many common uses. It's important to pay attention to the context to understand the specific meaning. It can mean to physically take something out, to obtain something, to take someone out, or to bring something to light.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Yo saco la basura cada día.","correct":"Yo saco la basura todos los días.","note":"'Cada día' is less common than 'todos los días' for expressing 'every day'."},{"incorrect":"Sacó un libro a la biblioteca.","correct":"Sacó un libro de la biblioteca.","note":"To take a book *from* the library, use 'de'. To take a book *to* the library, use 'a'."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["sacada (noun: taking out, extraction)","sacacorchos (noun: corkscrew)","sacamuelas (noun: dentist (informal))"],"phrases":["sacar de quicio (to drive crazy)","sacar pecho (to puff out one's chest, to be proud)","sacar la cara por (to stand up for someone)","sacar los trapos sucios (to air dirty laundry)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"A2","frequency_google_ngram":"Very high","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"A2","text":"'Sacar' is a common verb that means 'to take out' or 'to get'. You can use it to say you're taking something out of a bag, or that you got a good grade. It's a useful word to know for everyday conversations.","priority":"★★★"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Voy a sacar el coche del garaje.","translation":"I'm going to take the car out of the garage.","type":"general","meaning_category":"take out"},{"sentence":"¿Puedes sacar una foto de nosotros?","translation":"Can you take a picture of us?","type":"general","meaning_category":"take a photo"},{"sentence":"Espero sacar buenas notas este semestre.","translation":"I hope to get good grades this semester.","type":"general","meaning_category":"get good grades"},{"sentence":"Ella sacó a su madre de la residencia.","translation":"She took her mother out of the nursing home.","type":"general","meaning_category":"take someone out"},{"sentence":"Tenemos que sacar la verdad a la luz.","translation":"We have to bring the truth to light.","type":"general","meaning_category":"bring to light"}]}
